metadata.Title: CVE-2010-2221 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple buffer overflows in the iSNS implementation in isns.c in (1) Linux SCSI target framework (aka tgt or scsi-target-utils) before 1.0.6, (2) iSCSI Enterprise Target (aka iscsitarget or IET) 1.4.20.1 and earlier, and (3) Generic SCSI Target Subsystem for Linux (aka SCST or iscsi-scst) 1.0.1.1 and earlier allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and daemon crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via (a) a long iSCSI Name string in an SCN message or (b) an invalid PDU.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-2221` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

iscsitarget - 2.4.20.3+svn499-0ubuntu2.3
iscsitarget-dkms - 2.4.20.3+svn499-0ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

tgt - 1:1.0.13-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: iscsitarget package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.20.3+svn499-0ubuntu2.3').
tgt package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.0.13-0ubuntu2').
